ELSA Integrated Spatial Planning Tool

Getting Started: Registration and Workspace Access

To use the ELSA tool, you need to register on the UN Biodiversity Lab (UNBL) platform and request access to a workspace with the ELSA tool enabled.

Registering on UNBL

Follow these steps to create your UNBL account:

Step 1: Access the Platform

  1. Click the ‘Launch map’ button on the UN Biodiversity Lab website to access the data app.

Step 2: Create Your Account

  1. Once the platform has loaded, select the account icon in the top right-hand corner and choose ‘sign up’. Enter your email, name, country, and institution (optional), and set your password to sign up.

Step 3: Verify Your Email

  1. You will receive an email within a few minutes. Follow the instructions in this email to verify your account.

Step 4: Login

  1. Once your account is verified, you can log-in using your email address and password each time you access the platform.

Requesting Workspace Access

Step 5: Request ELSA Tool Access

  1. To use the ELSA tool for your country, simply request a workspace on UN Biodiversity Lab using our form and indicate that you would like access to the ELSA tool. Feel free to reach out to us at support@unbiodiversitylab.org for further questions.

Step 6: Access Your Workspace

  1. Once the workspace has been created, you will receive email confirmation. You will be able to access it by:

    1. Navigating to the UNBL data app

    2. Toggling the workspace in the tab that appears after clicking on the ‘WORKSPACES’ tab in the top-left

    3. Clicking on ‘ANALYSES’ once you have chosen your workspace to view the ELSA tool

Note

ELSA tools can be created for one or multiple countries within your workspace. Click on the arrow to expand each tool.

Workspace Features

Once you have access to your workspace, you can:

  • Access pre-configured ELSA tools for your country or region

  • View and analyze existing analysis runs

  • Create new analysis runs with customized parameters

  • Download results and maps for external use

  • Collaborate with team members who have access to the same workspace

Important

If you encounter any issues during registration or workspace access, contact the UNBL support team at support@unbiodiversitylab.org for assistance.
